Patient Dashboard - Details.label: Admitting DRG
Patient Dashboard - Details.description: The admitting DRG when patient gets registered
Patient Dashboard - Details.Options: only 1 DRG is assigned at a time. it woud be the one that would give the hospital the most reimbursement

Patient Dashboard - Details.label: Working DRG
Patient Dashboard - Details.description:
The DRG the patient has been assigned to based on the review of the clinical data in the medical record.  The DRGs are a patient classification
scheme which provides a means of relating the type of patients a hospital treats (i.e., its case mix)
to the costs incurred by the hospital.  This is the form of reimbursement that the CMS uses to pay hospitals for Medicare and Medicaid recipients.
Patient Dashboard - Details.Options:
689-KIDNEY & URINARY TRACT INFECTIONS W MCC
820-LYMPHOMA & LEUKEMIA W MAJOR O.R. PROCEDURE W MCC
177-RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS & INFLAMMATIONS W MCC
433-CIRRHOSIS & ALCOHOLIC HEPATITIS W CC
467-REVISION OF HIP OR KNEE REPLACEMENT W CC
540-OSTEOMYELITIS W CC
652-KIDNEY TRANSPLANT
872-SEPTICEMIA OR SEVERE SEPSIS W/O MV >96 HOURS W/O MCC
312-SYNCOPE & COLLAPSE

Patient Dashboard - Details.label: Final DRG
Patient Dashboard - Details.description: The final DRG when patient gets discharged

Patient Dashboard - Details.label: ALOS
Patient Dashboard - Details.description: The actual length of stay based on DRG
Patient Dashboard - Details.Options: Current Date minus Date of admission

Patient Dashboard - Details.label: IQ Criteria Status
Patient Dashboard - Details.description: The status of the criteria for the stay of the patient using Interqual guidelines. InterQualÂ® An evidence-based clinical decision support solution to help payers, providers, and government agencies make clinically appropriate medical utilization decisions.

Risk Score.name: InterQual criteria is partially met
Risk Score.advice: Ensure that unmet criteria, as specified in the left pane, are resolved.

Risk Score.name: Insurance coverage
Risk Score.advice: Anthem BCBS has a low rate of denying patients with similar profiles.

Risk Score.name: Admitting doctor
Risk Score.advice: The admiting doctor frequently receives denials due to extended length of stay.

Risk Score.name: Procedure is medically necessary
Risk Score.advice: The procedures enacted were deemed to be medically necessary by InterQual.

Risk Score.name: No readmissions
Risk Score.advice: Higher readmissions leads to greater denials.
